What is the reason for this?
I am crawling only my own site and there are n=
o politeness considerations,in this way it will take my for ages to index m=
y site... What can I do to make all 10 threads and queues functional?
Thank=
 you

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrot=
e:
>
> This is a wholly normal state for a crawl that's still working on on=
e queue.
> 
> "10 exhausted" means that 10 queues once had URIs in them, bu=
t finished.
> 
> "1 in-process" means one queue has offered up a URI which =
is in the 
> middle of a processing cycle. Looking at the frontier report w=
ill reveal 
> which queue offered the URI, the count of other URIs in that =
queue, and 
> other details. Looking at the threads report will reveal the =
processor 
> currently working on the in-process URI.
> 
> With a single qu=
eue still holding URIs, and normal politeness settings, 
> you would expect=
 on subsequent viewings of this summary to see the queue 
> bouncing from '=
in-process' to 'snoozed' and back, until the queue is 
> exhausted. If occa=
sionally new URIs are discovered on other hosts, other 
> queues might reen=
ter active crawling as well.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> On 12/26/10 10:00 AM, =
yotpo.official wrote:
> > I am running with 10 threads and 10 queues and th=
is is my frontier summary after a while:
> >
> >   RUN - 11 URI queues: 1 a=
ctive (1 in-process; 0 ready; 0 snoozed); 0 inactive; 0 ineligible; 0 retir=
ed; 10 exhausted
> >
> > Anybody knows why is it happening?
> >
> > Thank y=
ou very much
